docs.snippet: Jacob Stulberg grabs the mic for today’s puzzle.

A New Jersey man serving a lengthy prison term for running a $200 million Ponzi-style real estate scheme has lost his bid to withdraw his guilty plea and have charges he admitted to in another case dismissed.

headline.print_headline: Court: Man Can't Withdraw Guilty Plea in Real Estate Scheme
headline.main: Court: Man Can't Withdraw Guilty Plea in Real Estate Scheme

docs.snippet: With the ability to communicate securely and free, the messaging app has become a mainstay for those who have left their homes for the unknown.

headline.print_headline: A Shared Lifeline for Millions of Migrants
headline.main: For Millions of Immigrants, a Common Language: WhatsApp

docs.snippet: Officials said gunmen killed at least seven people at the home of Mir Wali, a prominent figure in the southern province of Helmand, who survived.

docs.snippet: Farmers and fishermen in the Niger Delta say they have suffered for years because of large spills from oil pipelines.

headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Niger Delta Communities Sue Shell Over Pipeline Spills
headline.main: Shell and Nigerian Partner Are Sued in Britain Over Spills

docs.abstract: Farming and fishing communities in Nigeria's Niger Delta file suit against Royal Dutch Shell in London over oil spills from pipelines.

docs.snippet: Gillian Walsh’s oddly titled work, a meditative dance piece that draws on multiple sources, is being performed at New York Live Arts.

headline.print_headline: The Title of This Work Does Not Have Typos. Really.

docs.snippet: A Kentucky Republican state House candidate is refusing to apologize for several Facebook posts depicting President Obama and the first lady as monkeys, but the state GOP chairman has condemned the posts and issued his own apology for them.

headline.print_headline: GOP Hopeful Not Sorry for Posts Depicting Obamas as Monkeys
headline.main: GOP Hopeful Not Sorry for Posts Depicting Obamas as Monkeys
